Welcome to the all in one base challenge!

The rules are simple, one base that isn't docked together. Mean you have to build one base, do it in one launch and land it on one planet

The base MUST have

1 Science bay jr

1 Mystery goo

A capsule that can hold at least 3 kerbals

1 Rover that can carry 1 kerbal

1 Power unit

Good Luck!

The rules are simple, one base that isn't docked together.

Might make more sense if the goal was to make an outpost in one piece that could house x amount of kerbals and provide fuel. As an example a drone lander, capable of accommodating 10 kerbals, sent to one of the Jool moons before an actual mission to the moons.

This actually reminds me of this:

The part of that mission where the rover assembles the base resembles how this challenge could be done. You would just modify it so that it could be done in one launch with a payload of Kerbals. Wouldn't be as big or elaborate as that base ends up being, but it would meet this challenge presuming the base doesn't have to be hard connected (IE, via docking ports rather than KAS's pipes) to one another.
